meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let's get this review party started!

Red Dead Redemption 2 (RDR2) - the game that has every critic going gaga, including yours truly. I mean, who wouldn't love a game that lets you ride horses, shoot guns, and get all up in your feelings? It's like the ultimate Western fantasy come true! And yet, as much as I want to join the chorus of "100%!" reviews, I've gotta bring my A-game (get it?) and give you the lowdown.

Now, let's get this out of the way: RDR2 is a masterclass in game design. The world is meticulously crafted, the characters are complex and well-written, and the story is a slow-burning masterpiece that'll keep you hooked till the very end. It's like being part of an old-timey Western movie, minus the pesky out-of-date attitudes and questionable morals (just kidding, Rockstar - sorta).

But what really sets RDR2 apart is its attention to detail. I mean, we're talking level-up, people! From the way characters move to the sound design to the sheer amount of content packed into this game... it's like a love letter to gaming itself. And yet, with great power comes great responsibility (or something like that). The game's pacing can be a bit wonky at times, and some folks might find the open-world aspects a tad too similar to previous Rockstar titles.

So, what do I think? Well, let me put it this way: if you're not already a fan of Westerns or open-world games, RDR2 will probably convert you. If you are, well... then you know exactly what I mean. It's like the ultimate love letter to gaming, and I'm not just talking about the copious amounts of horseback riding (although, let's be real - that's a major selling point).

In conclusion, RDR2 is a game-changer. It's the kind of game that'll make you question your priorities, abandon all plans for the day (or week), and just sit back and enjoy the ride. So, if you haven't already, saddle up and join the gang - but don't say I didn't warn you about the 100-hour mark...
